website_summaries.verdict: Produces a rich lather. Ideal shaving brush made from 100% natural soft badger hair.
pros: Manufactured from sturdy badger hair with an ergonomic handle to ensure firm grip
cons: Slight shedding may occur during the first few uses

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto Badger Shaving Brush
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time user of a shaving brush and really didn't know what to expect. I did some research before choosing this particular shaving brush. I chose this brush because of the material used and it's quality. I am not dissatisfied for choosing this brush. The bristles are soft but yet sturdy. It appears the brush will last as the bristles stay on the brush use after use. There are so many shaving brushes to choose from but I recommend trying this brush first and see what you think. The price is right and excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great brush for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a DE razor for a few months and love the shave. I have/had no knowledge of the different tools needed for a good shave so I relied on a friend for recommendations. He suggested an Escali brush which I purchased on Amazon. It was a really bad suggestion as It was a terrible brush. It began shedding on the 1st day out of the box which I have learned is normal. It continued losing the bristles until a few weeks after purchase it was losing a couple of dozen each shave. So being fed up I pitched the Escali and bought this perfecto brush. I could not be happier. Its a great brush for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush to replace a different brand I have had for many years. I forgot how nice a new brush feels and works. I have used this about a week and, so far, very little problems with shedding. It really works up a better lather than the old brush and works well with my shave soap. I do not use a cup, but place the creme directly on the tip of the brush and work it into the brush and my beard at the same time. I have noticed fewer nicks than before (actually none) and that is welcomed.
customer_reviews.author: CDL

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine brush for a very agreeable price.
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about fancy expensive shaving brushes. The one this brush replaces was a Fathers Day gift bought at a local dime store and it lasted me 40 years. This one is better than that, clearly. It handles well, works up a perfectly satisfactory lather, isn't too soft and isn't shedding. I'm 100% pleased. I'd buy it again but I'll be surprised if I ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Compton

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Shave Brush
customer_reviews.text: So far, this product holds up better than other brushes that I've bought. Most of the other brushes will start shedding after the first use. From what I've read this is normal and the shedding eventually stops. Unfortunately, with most brushes they continue to shed and it never stops. With the Perfecto shaving brush I haven't had this problem. In the time I've been using it, It hasn't shed a hair. I would suggest that to extend the life of your brush, when drying it you should hang the brush on a stand allowing the brush to air dry (as opposed to laying it on it's side). I would definitely recommend buying a Perfecto brush.
customer_reviews.author: Tom_Y

customer_reviews.title: Best Badger Bristle Brush Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a brush and straight razor shaver for 40 years. I have used many brushes over these years and this Perfecto Badger bristle is by far the BEST! I have always known that a natural bristle is superior to a synthetic bristle. It holds moisture and provides a better performance whether painting or shaving. This Perfecto Badger Bristle is the best brush yet! It holds the moisture to keep the soap soft, warm and flowing to give a great feel and wet your whiskers for a great, effortless shave. Get one! You won’t be sorry! It will last you for many years. Bruce
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Quality brush
customer_reviews.text: A great lather requires a great brush and this one fits the bill as chipper as a Clancey on the noontime of old Bella Gesticulate of the Nancy Romonovacuum Belly Singers of Belvedere. So pick up a dozen of these fine brushes today and tonight the sweet lily gingersnap puppies may sing you to sleep as soft as a toad's iPad, and as warm as the inside of guppies small intestine.
customer_reviews.author: That Old Guy from Texas

customer_reviews.title: To early to tell?
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have any issues with this brush. I didn’t have any issues with the brush that this one replaced, at this stage of its life either! It will be interesting to see how well this one holds up; my last brush lasted 2 years and was at the same price point! I really like the stiffness of these bristles as they are a bit more stiffer than than old brush which progressively deteriorated over its life. We shall see!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the best shave of your life
customer_reviews.text: I've been shaving my face for 57 0f my 77 years and did it grudgingly and only out of necessity. I recently purchased a Perfecto 100 % pure badger brush to replace the canned shaving cream I had been using. After a good soaking with hot water and working up a frothing warm lather, shaving is a new and much more pleasant experience . My shaves are cleaner and closer and painting my face with the brush is like a soft, warm kiss. I use it with a safety razor but have ordered a straight edge to complete the experience.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: What a brush!
customer_reviews.text: I have been shaving well over 50 years, in all that time always used a shaving brush and soap. Good brushes were a rarity or I was plain lazy, so would always buy a brush at the local drugstore. Each brush I bought was OK nothing great as they did not have thick softer boars hairs and hairs would fall out. They never produced a nice thick yet moist soap foam. These brushes I'm more than happy with making shaving, not such a task one must do and felts soft to the skin and yet making a good lather. I bought one for my son for Christmas and he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Fronczek

customer_reviews.title: A very nice and sturdy brush
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for my DE shave. It lathers up soap nicely and applies a nice even coat of soap. What I really like about it is that it retains its shape even after all of the mashing I give it while working the soap into a lather. It has a slight "off" smell to it when removed from the box, but I no longer smell that now that it's been used. Pros: -lathers soap well -retains its shape -fits nicely into a brush hanger Cons: -a musky smell when first opened
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Geek

customer_reviews.title: amazing brush
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my first safety razor and after doing some research on the internet and youtube multiple people pointed out to this shaving brush. I am so happy with my purchase and for anyone looking into purchasing their first brush look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Noe the Weasel

customer_reviews.title: Make Shaving Fun Again
customer_reviews.text: Shaving is now a production and the brush & dish make it fun. But it definitely requires more time than shaving in the shower. If you have time in your schedule I highly encourage you to use the brush/dish/straight razor method. And get yourself some top notch shaving cream.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great brush, fabulous price!
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously low price for a good quality badger shaving brush. I'm very pleased with the quality of this brush. It's lost 3-4 hairs so far which is better than par for the course for a new brush. It's soft on the face and easily produces a thick, rich lather with all of my shaving soaps. The handle is easy to grip and looks great to me eye as well. All in all, it's the same price as my boar brush and softer and whips up a thicker lather quicker. I bought this as a package with their razor and brush stand which is very high quality as well. For the price, the quality is high and I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...but end up happy with the value.
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE 11/25** I was a bit premature with my first assessment. I never used a shaving brush prior so not knowing the proper way to use it caused the issues. So now, it's held up thus far, gets a nice lather and no longer losing fibers. So far I am happy with the product and would recommend it to anyone. --------------- Well it was my first brush I ever used or bought so can't compare it to another. What I can say is its not built to last, fibers already coming out after only 3 uses and not even using it the way I should I am sure. Looks nice, but breaks down...guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Big-T

customer_reviews.title: After a year of using this badger brush it is still holding up great. The handle finish has not faded and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product a year ago, and I am giving an update on this purchase. After a year of using this badger brush it is still holding up great. The handle finish has not faded and the Perfecto label is still visible. I used the brush at least 4 days a week, and did a maintenance cleaning of it only twice. The bristles are soft, but firm enough to lift my coarse hair (I am African-American). Further more, the bristles did not fall out abnormally, with only about one or two falling periodically. For the price, this brush is more than worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: V. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Soft and a good value
customer_reviews.text: I traded in my boars-hair brush for this one, and it's much softer! It does prickle a little bit, which leads me to believe the fur was trimmed, rather than naturally aligned. But for the price, you won't find much better. It does lose some of its fibers occasionally, but not often. I'll be getting another for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Tintin

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It’s a $20 badger brush. It’s softish, the handle is short for my liking, but it does have a decent knot on it. It softens up over time. It’s a good beginner brush. A longer handled, silver tip badger brush is where you really want to be looking. They’re soft from the get go, and always create a great lather. With short handled brushes, my hand gets tired, and can actually cramp up while making a lather. I’m a younger guy too! I’ll put a photo of it next to a silver tip badger brush and you’ll see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: ProtectURSelf

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto 100% Pure Badger Shaving Brush
customer_reviews.text: The 100% Pure Badger Shaving Brush from Perfecto is very soft and provides a smooth application to your face and shave areas. Really nice product combined with the Parker Long Handle Shaver, Henry Cavendish Himalaya soap, Henry Cavendish Soap Dish, and the Perfecto Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand, made shaving easy close and clean. I haven't had a clean shave like this in ages.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brogan

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase. This brush is of the highest quality equal to that of shaving brushes costing in the hundred dollar range. I know this because I have bought and used expensive brushes. I use this brush regularly and it is excellent and well made. The price is remarkably inexpensive and misleading in that the prospective buyer might think it is of the same quality of other brushes in the same price range and more. But it is NOT! Buy this brush! You will not be disappointed but very pleased that you did!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It made it here on time
customer_reviews.text: I have just returned from a big trip, but prior to leaving I had ordered this Shaving Brush along with other toiletry items. I received everything else except the brush after contacting Amazon, the replacement was sent post haste, I received it the day before I was to depart. I first used it and was pleasantly delighted. I am sure it will be with me for many years. Oh did I say it was very soft and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: ELM's

customer_reviews.title: Ouch! This thing HURTS!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new brush so I decided to buy a new one. I'm not looking for anything too fancy, which is why I landed on this one, but I wish I had just gone to Target and bought their cheap one. First, the bristles on this thing HURT when brushed on your face, making wet shaving an unenjoyable experience. Second, the bristles are also too long, therefore it is hard to work up a good lather without crushing the bristles. Final note: If you want a badger brush either pay a little more and go fancy or just stick with the cheapo ones that don't scar your face everytime you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Spell

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great deal of lather
customer_reviews.text: Have used a synthetic brush for about 5+ years and have had good experience until they fail and then it was complete mess. This was shown as a companion piece to the straight razor being purchased. Being actual Badger hair it warranted trying to see if it really made a difference seeing as the price is significantly more than a synthetic brush. The bristles are exceptionally soft but not so much that once wet with lather that it did not interact with the facial hair. The brush is comfortable in the hand and makes a significant amount of lather when used appropriately. Time will be the ultimate test to determine the longevity of the brush. Definitely recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Pope Zeke

customer_reviews.title: A little smaller than the last brush but very easy too use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this brush after my first one from another company fell apart. This brush arrived within the 2 day period and was very well packaged. Out of the box this brush far exceeded the first brush that I was using by far. A little smaller than the last brush but very easy too use. Held the shaving cream well and covered my face very smoothly. For the money, I would recommend this brush to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Yes it is that good
customer_reviews.text: Ever wanted to lather up a badger and rub it on your face? I did too and that's why I bought this product. It is soft yet sturdy and feels great on the face. It did lose some bristles the first couple times using it but it has stopped since. It soaks up water how I want it to and to get the water out I just squeeze it and its dry again. I have no problems with this brush at all and will probably buy another when this one breaks or loses its bristles, which I don't see happening soon.
customer_reviews.author: BryanS

customer_reviews.title: Nice and soft but firm enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought this brush to use cleaning my boots and shoes with saddle soap. It is soft enough so it does not scratch the finish on my patent leather dress shoes from my military days and yet firm enough to get my hunting boots clean down to the tightest part of the uppers so they stay soft and quiet and relatively safe from the water I often wade through while hunting and hiking. I learned this trick in the Guard about fifty years ago and it still works quite well. Get a good brush, take care of it and it will last forever while cleaning tough jobs like dirty, dry hunting boots.
customer_reviews.author: Nashoba Losa

customer_reviews.title: Great starter brush!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginners brush and was the first brush I purchased when I started wet shaving 2 years ago. Feels great on my face ( I face lather) and has held up well over 2 years. It is no longer my go to brush but I still use it when I travel. It wont break the bank and is perfect for someone just getting into wet shaving. I purchased another not to long ago for a friend who was just starting out and he loves it
customer_reviews.author: T. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Good brush for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush back in April, 2016. This review is written four years later in August, 2020. As you can see in the pictures, after shaving twice a week for four years brush got some signs of wear and tear. Considering that really good quality brushes can go for hundreds of dollars, I really like this brush. Only recently some bristles started to come out. Paint started to chip off about a year ago. I still probably will use this brush for another 6 months or so. It met my needs. If you are shaving everyday, maybe this is not the best investment.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: It's FINE! Why Did I Waste So Much Time Researching These?
customer_reviews.text: I researched the heck out of these. Probably because the price variance is SO WIDE. I finally settled on this cheaper brush. I don't need the best of the best, why did I waste so much time researching?? Mind-numbing 1. So it's slightly prickly. No biggie. 2. It's a little smelly too. I'm sensitive to smell and it doesn't bother me at all. Lets all remember it comes from a dead animal, and that processing is a pretty chemical-heavy process whether it's an expensive brush or not. 3. The thing works just fine. Almost a year later. little to no shedding, no chipping handle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Milazzo

customer_reviews.title: Extreme softness and build quality
customer_reviews.text: I love a traditional shave and, as such, have owned several brushes over the years. This one is amongst the best. The bristles are exceptionally soft, real badger fur (not all brushes are equal in this regard), PLUS the hair doesn't come out when you use the brush or wash it. This things creates loads of lather, cleans easily and makes shaving a relaxing experience. It's lighter than you might think (neither good nor bad) and I keep mine on a stand to promote drying. Hopefully it lasts a long time because it's a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to order a tube of glue as well!
customer_reviews.text: My husband asked me to buy him a shave brush because the one he purchased fell apart after a short time. I bought this purely because the great reviews. When It arrived my husband laughed and showed me that it was the exact same brand and model that he had bought. This new brush has fallen apart.(top holding bristles was not glued to base) Two for two are pretty terrible odds and shows that this is NOT a quality product . I do not know why this product has so many great reviews. I can fix the defect myself but I shouldn’t need to.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do your face a nice favor...
customer_reviews.text: There’s nothing like a genuine badger shaving brush when applying shaving cream to one’s face. This brush, in particular, is really nice and soft and the high quality is clearly evident. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. F. WhiteTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Soft bristles have a nice face feel, but can be more difficult to load your brush with harder soaps. I tend to use my firmer hog hair brush for my hard soap and this badger hair brush for croap/soft soap. Can't beat the price. Wood handle. No bristles have come out so no issues with "shedding" that I'be experienced with other brushes (although it is still relatively new).
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy T

customer_reviews.title: Bristles are abandoning the brush!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shaving brush just over six months ago. After only a few uses, I would have easily given it a five star rating. The brush is soft and, even for its small size, whips up a nice lather with my Neutragena unscented bar soap. But here I'm am six months later and am disappointed. Daily, multiple bristles are abandoning their responsibility and taking refuge on my face. Other shorter ones are coming out of the brush and sticking to the soap. (I'm puzzled why there are and half inch bristles in the brush.) It's not a terrible brush, but really should have a better lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Quality is my only hang up.
customer_reviews.text: I loved using the brush for shaving but I am being a little harsh on my review because with the amount of research I did and the number of competing products, j just assumed I was buying something highly dependable. The attach image is 4 1⁄2 months after I purchased it. It stayed in my showed on the corner and not under direct water. I may have dropped the 3 feet to the floor of the show at some point but it never came separated at that time. I just expect the glue to bold longer than 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Blev

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, wish I would have bought this one years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent feel, good solid handle, perfect length of bristles. I’ve had a number of brushes over the years, this is the first one in a long time I’ve bought where I wasn’t at least slightly disappointed. Most people who use brushes know what I mean when I say that when you use a new brush for the first time you’re either immediately thinking of the next brush you’ll buy, or you don’t have that thought at all.... I really like this brush. If I ever have to get a new one, it’ll hopefully be this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A.

customer_reviews.title: Lesser quality than you deserve
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am not a fan of this brush. Within 6 months of use, the knot litterally fell out of the handle. I guess they didn’t use enough glue to hold it in place. I had to epoxy it back into place so I could continue to use the brush. My other issue with this brush is that it loses hair faster than me. It leaves hair in my shaving soaps, the sink and after shaking it clean I need to comb through it grabbing bristles that have come free of the knot. This has become my backup brush because I am fairly confident if I used it every day, it would be bald by now.
customer_reviews.author: PJY

customer_reviews.title: I believe I should read the product's size dimensions a bit more since I find the handle being a bit shorter then I would have l
customer_reviews.text: I received my brush and found it of being decent quality. I believe I should read the product's size dimensions a bit more since I find the handle being a bit shorter then I would have liked. One more comment I should add is that my brush came with a small chip where it is painted. I will submit a picture of this...overall I believe I purchased a good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Favia

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Update* minutes after submitting my review I was contacted by the company who offered to send me a new brush. Great customer service there!!! They sent me a new brush and it has been fantastic! No cracks and the brush has stayed on. Wonderful quality. It is clear that the prior brush was just an anomaly. The paint on the handle started cracking after less than a month of owning the brush. I ignored it because I was still able to use the brush. That was until this morning when the brush popped out from the handle after using it for less than two months!
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice brush
customer_reviews.text: I got a new job where I have to shave every morning so I decided to try switching to a safety razor. I bought this razor based on the reviews and looks. It matches my other pieces. It does a nice job making foam and the bristles seem to be holding up well. My only complaint so far is after about a month of use I noticed a decent sized chip in the handle. I've never dropped it so I'm not sure where it came from. I do have 2 kids so I'm not blaming the company when I don't know the cause. This is the setup I ordered: Razor: Stand: Blades: Soap: Brush:
customer_reviews.author: Darlene and David

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my last brush
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than my last brush. This one I don't think I have lost any of the hairs. Although there was a dye or something on it that colored my soap. This is the third brush I have ever had and I will buy this one again. The first was bore and it lasted a couple of years. My second I only kept for a few months as the hairs were falling out by the dozens. This one hardly any hairs have come out and it is very soft.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L.

customer_reviews.title: Love the brush and not just because of the price.
customer_reviews.text: From what I understand all brushes lose hair especially at the beginning and this is no different. When brushing this feels very soft and relaxing moving over my face. When poking this brush is stiff. I find that a good thing as the bristles will not fall over with the weight of the lather. I don't have anything else to compare this to as this is my first brush. But I would definitely buy this again especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: jeffTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Quality brush
customer_reviews.text: A great quality brush. Due to my toxic masculinity and Gillette products utter stupidity, I decided to disown them after 35 years of using their garbage. This brush with a quality shaving soap is ten times better than the gel which I have used for so many years. Gives you a cleaner, closer shave and my skin feels so much better after shaving. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: palabras

customer_reviews.title: Wash Before Using to Get Rid of Stray Hairs
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely leave reviews for many reasons I won't go into here. For this Badger brush, I had to because this brush out of many, too many brushes I have bought is really Wonderful. Yes, you heard me correctly, this Perfecto Badger Brush is absolutely wonderful. I am going to buy another to make sure I have one waiting for me when something happens to this one. Or before you all buy them up. Ben
customer_reviews.author: Ben V.

customer_reviews.title: really good brush - handle not so much
customer_reviews.text: The brush has has broken in nicely and I can make a very good lather with it, but sadly I can't recommend it since the paint on the handle started to peel on the 2nd use. For the money there are much better brushes out there. 3/18 Update: it's been less than 6 months and the paint is pretty much gone - the brush is still in good condition. I'm updating from 4 to 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: Agustin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this while it lasted. Barely, a year and the black handle starts cracking and large pieces fall of piece by piece. I expected this to last a few years like my last one. Unfortunately, at this cost, it was not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: estacadaoregon

customer_reviews.title: A touch of elegance from the past..
customer_reviews.text: This shaving brush is the ‘cat’s meow.” It is t he perfect vehicle to deliver hot water and a fine lather to your face. Every time i use it, i feel like I’m part of a 1930s movie- try it. And you’ll also be “singing in the rain.”
customer_reviews.author: john kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Feels GREAT. Great Value for a brush P.S. I Paid $10 this brush is a great value at $10.
customer_reviews.text: Feels GREAT. Great Value for a brush. It didn't smell like roses, but it didn't smell like "hair from around the anus" as some other brushes have been reviewed. 4 shaves so far with minimal hair loss. The hair loss is a minor annoyance. Update: I Paid $10 this brush is a great value at $10.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: It is what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice shaving brush .. for the price. It does the job. that's the plus. The minus is it started losing bristles with the first shave. It is a less expensive brush. It will probably last a year, maybe a year and 1/2. That is to be expected for the price. If you want something really nice, you're going to pay $40 to $50.
customer_reviews.author: wolfinwolfsclothing

customer_reviews.title: Great way to start the morning
customer_reviews.text: I was suspect, given this unit's low price point, but after a couple weeks of use the Perfecto seems up to the job as much as fancier (and I'm sure more expensive) ones my wife had bought previously. Sure the handle is plastic and the logo a little tacky, but if you or anyone else is paying that much attention to your shaving kit, you've probably bigger issues in life! Have yet to see any real shedding. Definitely a firm/full brush - but not scratchy or slimy feeling. Seems to air dry in a day between uses when given a couple of shakes and hung in a stand.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A. Nordin

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I tried to find a replacement brush after my Bass brush bit it. Nothing local, so I was pleased to find this on Amazon. It is the kind of brush I like to use, full boar bristle and wood handle. Yeah, it will shed a bit, but worked great on the first shave.
customer_reviews.author: Guy L. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Not Exactly "Perfecto"
customer_reviews.text: I shave in the shower and last February bought a manly shaving brush...For a few months, everything worked fine..lather, brush, cup, and shave...However, my manly bliss was interrupted two months later when the brush handle completely separated from the brush...While I eventualy managed to hot-glue everything together, this brand should change its name to "Imperfecto"
customer_reviews.author: Public

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile investment in self-indulgence
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've had it for a week. It makes great lather, feels stimulating on my face, and has only lost two bristles both when I first started using it. It's much better than the boar hair one I replaced. I like how it looks, it fits great in my brush stand, and was priced where buying and using feels just the right level of self-indulgence.
customer_reviews.author: Chromatic8

customer_reviews.title: Overall the brush is great the wood base is not.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am happy with the bristles because they don't irritate my skin and are not falling off after several months of usage. However, the base cracked and piece came off after it fell from the sink and also the coating started falling out. This is the reason I gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pin.2

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Feels great. This is my first shaving brush and the Vikings Shave Cream made a lather very quickly. I'm not using a bowl because of the size of my bathroom but it works well and has given me a reason to shave. Has a mild smell that reminds me of when skinning rabbits but only after running it under warm water. I'm going to assume that over time the oils in my shave creams will over take that smell. It really only bothers me when it is warm and under my nose.
customer_reviews.author: Wilk5

customer_reviews.title: What an Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My other synthetic no name brush just fell apart. I needed something that would last and travel well. I came to the right spot. Just as advertised. Very minimal shedding at first, approx first 3 to 5 uses. Please not some minor things, rinse well and store upside down. I'll update within the next 3 to 6 months. So far PERFECT!!!
customer_reviews.author: keniel

customer_reviews.title: Well made - lathers quickly
customer_reviews.text: This brush arrived on time and was as described; it replaced a Van der Hagen brush that started to lose its bristles after less than 2 years. The bristles on the Perfecto are more pliable, but the tips are still firm - it is not as soft as the Van der Hagen, but is still comfortable to use. More importantly, it develops a lather much faster than any other brush I have used. I would definitely recommend this brush to anyone looking to enhance their shaving routine.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the lesser quality brush I was using
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't used a shaving brush and soap in years and had forgotten how much nicer it was than the gel shave creams. I wasn't thrilled with the lesser quality brush I had and orderred the Perfecto 100% Pure Badger Hair Shave Brush. I could immediately feel the difference on my face and head. I shave both and I don't see myself going back to gels. I highly recommend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholm

customer_reviews.title: Brush doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brush in January 2019. I have had it six months and yesterday (after buying the brush and razor stand) the entire knob of badger hair came out of the wooden handle. The handle actually didn't fit into the new stand I bought. I don't understand why it didn't fit as it is advertised from the same company. Now I am not sure what to do with the brush. I believe I will have to get some crazy glue and try to glue the hair back into the wooden handle. Not very happy with regards to this product. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: spratt

customer_reviews.title: Great shaving brush
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars all round. I thought about not for softness, as it is not silly-soft - It picks up the soap since the bristles have an ever-slight non-softness. Plently comfortable in every respect. Perfect balance. I'll buy it as a gift, but I expect it will last 10+ years so probably not for myself again soon.
customer_reviews.author: TJ South

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This brush is smaller than the other shaving brushes I own, but it works as well if not better. It feels right in my hand, lathers soap well, glides over my face with warm lather, and cleans easily. Because of its smaller size, you can put it in a travel kit with ease without taking up too much space.
customer_reviews.author: Coach

customer_reviews.title: Whips up great lather
customer_reviews.text: I really love this brush. I had been using an "antique" one but thought it was kind of stiff so decided to try a new one. What an improvement. Very soft and comfortable. It really makes a nice lather. Also dries quickly. A few bristles came out at first but none after a couple weeks of use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Fore

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good brush with just the right amount of stiffness to work a lather around stubble. Has a nice weighty base so that it stands upright well too. I had an Art of Shaving brush before that after 3 years had bristles coming loose. I prefer this one to it even though it had served me well for so long.
customer_reviews.author: keb

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about a month ago and this brush is just awful. Not sure if I'd have been able to return it due to it having contact with my face but I'd heavily recommend going with a different brand. My old brush at a similar price which is wearing out is substantially better than this new one.
customer_reviews.author: D S in FLA

customer_reviews.title: cracked handle
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel of the badger bristles. I had been using another shaving brush for years, and this was a huge improvement. However, I noticed that the handle cracked after a year's use. I don't remember dropping it, but if I did, it would have landed on a soft, carpeted floor.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer George

customer_reviews.title: Easily beats the off-the-shelf boar bristle brush from the local drugstore
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading to this from my cheap old boar bristle brush made a big difference in lather quality and shaving comfort. After several months, the lacquer on the handle chipped has in one spot (I may have dropped it though) but the bristles remain firmly attached and as soft as ever. Definitely want to use a stand to hang this on to dry after each use. I rinse and flick mine without squeezing the bristles. A couple of good flicks gets the water out.
customer_reviews.author: DPS

customer_reviews.title: Handle fell off after two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first brush. I'm surprised by how much I like using a brush for shaving, but the handle fell off this brush after a couple weeks. The handle is made of wood, which of course swells if wet for long. That make the handle crack it's plastic cover and fall of the brush.
customer_reviews.author: P N

customer_reviews.title: The Only Way to Shave
customer_reviews.text: I am a convert. Just put a very small dab on the wet bristles and creative a lather on your face using a circular motion. It tickles a little, but stands those whiskers on end. Using your hand to apply shaving cream just mashes them down. Check out some YouTube videos.
customer_reviews.author: An Ohio Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality badger hair
customer_reviews.text: The badger hair is very poor quality. As a Guild trained artist, I am very familiar with a wide variety of animal hairs used to make brushes, and the hair used in this is coarse and refined. You will immediately feel the poor quality on your skin.
customer_reviews.author: MA Toal

customer_reviews.title: The handle cracked within a week
customer_reviews.text: I liked the brush but the handle cracked after the first week and the bristles came out. They were still in the metal ring so I glued it all back in. Still using it with the cracked handle. The handle is made of wood.
customer_reviews.author: D&H

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally Reasonable and High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This shave bush works superbly but it is exceptionally reasonable in cost. No need to pay high prices for a shave brush. This one works well and covers the face nicely with lather for a close shave. I highly recommend it to anyone, especially cost-conscious consumers.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Stop searching, buy it! Its good.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first brush, i followed many instructional youtube videos on how to get it ready and how tp use it properly. So far i am very happy with it! It loads up and Lathers cream very well! I discovered thos brush by a “best shaving brush” google search and it was in the top three. For the price compared to the others, i bought it. Very happy with the brush, when ...if.. it ever wears out, i will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Very Prickly not Soft
customer_reviews.text: This brush makes great lather and provides a great base for shaving. I have only used it a handful of times as the brush is very prickly.
customer_reviews.author: NCisBeautiful

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These are my observations after using the brush for three weeks. 1. Well constructed. Only lost a few brisels 2. Very comfortable. The brisels are soft and plyable. 3. Holds ample lather for a shave. 4. Slightly smaller than other brushes I’ve used, but easy to get used to it. 5. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Quality brush
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than expected and as described. Have used almost daily for past month and it is a quality product. Tad bit smaller in mass not length than my old brush so took some time getting used to the different feel in hand however far better quality. No loose hair.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL D.

customer_reviews.title: Great brush
customer_reviews.text: I bought this handy little brush for my husband. He shaves every day for work and just started using a straight razor. Now I'll be honest, I dont know the difference between all these brushes. But he loves his. It works great and is the perfect size. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Leto

customer_reviews.title: Fine But Didn't Last
customer_reviews.text: This was my first shaving brush. Got it because of the great reviews. It worked fine for a while but the bristles are falling out at a frustrating rate in under a year. Perhaps half a dozen every time I use it. It's time to buy a new one and I'll be trying something else this time.
customer_reviews.author: FunkHouse9

customer_reviews.title: A well-made shaving brush.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to replace an old, worn out shaving brush. He said he loves it. It helps lather well, feels soft, rinses cleanly, and doesn't shed. I definitely love not having to wipe up all the little hairs every morning. It fit in the shaving stand I had bought him, so overall he is very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mary connell

customer_reviews.title: It stinks!
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer said, they must have got the hair off the badger's butt. This thing stinks! I've shaved several times since I received the item, thinking my shaving products' scent would override the stink, but it remains over-powering.
customer_reviews.author: John Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: Good brush, cheap build
customer_reviews.text: This brush was my first foray into honest-to-goodness "traditional" wet shaving. Seemed like a decent price point for an entry-level badger-hair brush, which research suggested was preferable. The brush itself is great, holds water well and generates a good lather in conjunction with the soap I used (Barrister and Mann). However, after several weeks of usage, the bristles and the handle separated. I have repaired the brush myself with Sugru, and while I'm unsurprised, I felt obligated to share my experience.
customer_reviews.author: DJP

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I just used it for the first time ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I just used it for the first time today. I like the soft bristles. Too early for a comprehensive review. How it does a year from now is critical and whether it starts losing bristles after 5 years is important. I shave with a straight razor therefore a good brush is critical UPDATE After 2 months it started shedding bristles and now it is shedding bristles like there is no tomorrow. It is completely unsatisfactory and has no value. I have been shaving with a straight razor for more than 50 years and have used shaving brushes the entire time. I can no longer use this brush as it leaves bristles all over my face
customer_reviews.author: Allen W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am updating this review to 5 stars due to the amazing customer service I received. When I was not thrilled with the brush I was offered a refund. Although I am not a fan of the product YMMV. Bottom line the company stands behind it making it a risk free purchase what do you have to lose. nothing special, it feels rough. Personally I would go with a higher quality boar bristle.
customer_reviews.author: Gutz-42

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. I don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in December, in January the brush ring fell out of the handle. I requested a new one, delivered on Jan 21 under “warranty”. on March 2nd the brush ring fell out off the handle on the second product. Return window closed on Jan 20th. I’ll just throw it away. Obviously cheaply made but I gave them a second chance, same result. I won’t buy from them again. I recommend you not either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Undecided
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why a brush is this expensive. First time I even touched my cream 2 bristles came out. Wondering how many more will come out in the future. This is heading towards your typical disappointment product made cheaply and sold on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: chris muench

customer_reviews.title: Nice brush; good quality.
customer_reviews.text: My husband received this for part of his Father's Day gift. He loves the brush. He has a beard so he shaves a couple of times a week to keep it looking groomed. He said the bristles are of good quality and he really liked using the brush.
customer_reviews.author: jgregory25

customer_reviews.title: Works well, however, could be softer and shed less
customer_reviews.text: Performs about as well as a value brush could be expected to perform. For the most part, it works well, however, the softness could be improved and it could be better at shedding and holding its form. Otherwise, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Braedon Giblin

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Nice brush. Doesn't shed much, smell or feel weird. The glue sticking the brush to the base came loose, making it harder to lather and apply. I am going to try to super glue it back together, but obviously something I shouldn't have to do with a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice brush but didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: This brush worked fine for the first four months, but then started shedding hairs, and picking hairs out of the blade in the middle of a shave is annoying. After six months, the brush came loose from the handle. I had to wrap a piece of duct tape around the end of the brush to force it back into the handle to use until I could buy a new brush. I use this brush in the shower and perhaps there was too much steam for it. In any event, I'm going to buy a higher quality brush next time.
customer_reviews.author: James Selth

customer_reviews.title: works up terrific lather
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brush. I had been using my old brush for a loooong time (30 years?) and I hadn't appreciated what a new brush would do. Further, I'm pretty sure my old brush wasn't badger hair. This is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this brush. The knot has a diameter at base of 21mm and a height of 50mm. I would rate the backbone as stiff, but that is a good thing. It works the lather well and comes clean easily. Affordable, so I would recommend it to all new wet shavers.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great little Badger for shaving
customer_reviews.text: Good even coverage, soft yet whips your shave cream very nicely. Holds a good amount of cream and cleans easily. Awesome brush for the price. There was very little shedding only one or two shaves had a bristle or two in them. Appears to have a proper glued bristle knot, so be careful to not run the water too hot. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner...
customer_reviews.text: I'm still a novice in terms of improving my method of shaving, but so far, the Pure Badger Shaving Brush has been working very well. Very good price also. Soft enough for the face yet firm enough to get a lather going. Only small issue is in first 1-2 uses, brush sheds a bit and it ends up in the shaving cream block as it's getting lathered......but I suspect that's typical for all new brushes. Hasn't really shed since. If your new to using a lather brush, strongly suggest to look up tutorials on you-tube....there is a method to this and it's helpful.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Brush For The Money
customer_reviews.text: For the price this brush is fantastic. I ordered an Escali brush before this brush and ended up with a big ball of glue in the middle of the Escali's bristles. This brush is beautiful and well made. The badger bristles are extremely soft and create a great lather with the soaps I use. You could spend a hundred on a handmade badger brush but it will function no differently than this one at a tenth of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: ➖Adam➖

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packaged with instructions on care and maintenance of shaving brush. I have not experienced noticeable shedding. The brush is on the small side but I like it. Sellers reached out via email to insure if everything was to my satisfaction. I’m enjoying my shaving brush.
customer_reviews.author: Paco

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a Badger brush. .
customer_reviews.text: This brush is one of my favorites. I have about 12 brushes and I find myself reaching for this one most frequent. Great value for the price. The quality is up there with other more expensive badgers.
customer_reviews.author: F. Valerio

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners such as myself. It does not smell like a wet dog as others do and gets the job done quite well. For the money you can’t go wrong. I’ll update if I had any issues with this product. Overall I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David Perez

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I loads up well and lays lather on well. I am used to boar bristle and a shouter feel. But if you like soft, then this is a very good brush. I do wish it were larger, but it does make it better for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great shaving brush that WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bristles to make a quick and easy thick lather and soft to the touch when applying to face. Very pleased with this brush. It also looks good with my black shave mug and safety razor.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Handle split after just a few weeks, testing replacement...
customer_reviews.text: Update - 3 STARS: The company has contacted me and offered a free replacement for what they believe was merely a defective brush. I have added a star to reflect their efforts to provide good customer service. I will update this review after we see how the replacement brush performs. Original review - 2 STARS: This looked so great and we were excited to get it. After only a few weeks the handle has split even thought it is *always* stored hanging downward in a proper stand. Disappointed & won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Idahome

customer_reviews.title: Pretty durable for my use and holds it shape so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 10 months ago and it is good as new! Use it almost everyday and can’t tell that it has work at all. Still lathers easily and feels pretty soft. Rinse it out and let it dry- no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Miller's High Life

product_meta.title: Perfecto 100% Pure Badger Shaving Brush-Black Handle- Engineered for The Best Shave of Your Life. for, Safety Razor, Double Edge Razor, Straight Razor or Shaving Razor, Its The Best Badger Brush.
feature_bullets: Brings water to the face for that perfect, true wet shave

Fits Perfectly in the "Perfecto Deluxe Chrome Razor and Brush Stand"PLEASE NOTE, that as with all genuine badger hair brushes, slight shedding may occur during the first few times in use--Handle color may vary--ONLY ONE BRUSH IS INCLUDED.
